doc:
Sheila Kuehl https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sheila_Kuehl 0 Sheila James Kuehl (born February 9, 1941) is an American politician, former child actor, and currently the member of the Los Angeles County Board of Supervisors for the 3rd District. In 1994, she became the first openly gay California legislator. Two years later, George magazine named her one of the 20 most fascinating women in politics and the California Journal selected her as "Rookie of the Year." The following year, she became the first woman in California history to be named Speaker pro tempore of the California State Assembly.[2] In 1998 and 2000, the California Journal chose her as the Assembly member with the greatest intelligence and the most integrity. During this time, she was twice selected to speak about family violence and diversity at the Democratic National Conventions. After serving six years in the State Assembly, Kuehl was elected to the California State Senate. Between 2000 and 2008, she authored 171 bills that were signed into law by three different governors, including legislation to formally incorporate the rights declared in Roe v. Wade into California state law. In 2006, the Capitol Weekly selected her as the most intelligent member of the California Legislature. The story of her role as the first lesbian in the state legislature, along with three other pioneering lesbian legislators, is told in the documentary, Political Animals. In 2014, she was elected to the Los Angeles County Board of Supervisors. In her capacity as Supervisor, she serves as Chair of the Board of Commissioners of First 5 LA, First Vice Chair of the Board of Directors of LA Metro, and sits on the Board of the new Community Choice Aggregation (CCA) known as the Clean Power Alliance. In her first three years on the Board, she has undertaken or collaborated in a number of initiatives and motions to improve the quality of life and reform systems in the County. A partial list of her achievements includes successfully championing the effort to raise the minimum wage, creating a Citizens' Oversight Commission for the Sheriff's Department, providing unprecedented funding and services for LA County's homeless population and those trying to find and keep affordable housing, and launching an historic Women and Girls Initiative to address the disproportionate burdens and disadvantages faced by women and girls. Kuehl also helped establish oversight of the Probation Department and is working to reform the adult and juvenile justice systems, emphasizing "second chance" and anti-recidivism programs. She supported the creation of the Office of Child Protection, and oversaw the opening of Campus Kilpatrick – a state-of-the-art juvenile justice facility that emphasizes trauma-informed rehabilitation. Sheila_James_Kuehl ( born February_9_,_1941 ) is an_American_politician , former_child_actor , and currently the_member of the_Los_Angeles_County_Board of Supervisors for the_3rd_District . In 1994 , she became the_first_openly_gay_California_legislator . Two_years later , George_magazine named her_one of the_20_most_fascinating_women in politics and the_California_Journal selected her as " Rookie of the_Year . " The_following_year , she became the_first_woman in California_history to_be_named Speaker_pro_tempore of the_California_State_Assembly . [_2_] In 1998_and_2000 , the_California_Journal chose her as the_Assembly_member with the_greatest_intelligence and the_most_integrity . During this_time , she was_twice_selected_to_speak about family_violence_and_diversity at the_Democratic_National_Conventions . After serving six_years in the_State_Assembly , Kuehl was_elected to the_California_State_Senate . Between 2000_and_2008 , she authored 171_bills that were_signed into law by three_different_governors , including legislation to_formally_incorporate the_rights declared in Roe_v._Wade into California_state_law . In 2006 , the_Capitol_Weekly selected her as the_most_intelligent_member of the_California_Legislature . The_story of her_role as the_first_lesbian in the_state_legislature , along with three_other_pioneering_lesbian_legislators , is_told in the_documentary , Political_Animals . In 2014 , she was_elected to the_Los_Angeles_County_Board of Supervisors . In her_capacity as Supervisor , she serves as Chair of the_Board of Commissioners of First_5_LA , First_Vice_Chair of the_Board of Directors of LA_Metro , and sits on the_Board of the_new_Community_Choice_Aggregation_(_CCA )_known as the_Clean_Power_Alliance . In her_first_three_years on the_Board , she has_undertaken_or_collaborated in a_number of initiatives_and_motions to_improve the_quality of life_and_reform_systems in the_County . A_partial_list of her_achievements includes_successfully_championing the_effort to_raise the_minimum_wage , creating a_Citizens '_Oversight_Commission for the_Sheriff 's_Department , providing unprecedented_funding_and_services for LA_County 's_homeless_population and those trying_to_find_and_keep affordable_housing , and launching an_historic_Women and Girls_Initiative to_address the_disproportionate_burdens and disadvantages faced by women_and_girls . Kuehl also helped_establish oversight of the_Probation_Department and is_working_to_reform the_adult_and_juvenile_justice_systems , emphasizing "_second_chance " and anti-recidivism_programs . She supported the_creation of the_Office of Child_Protection , and oversaw the_opening of Campus_Kilpatrick – a_state-of-the-art_juvenile_justice_facility that emphasizes trauma-informed_rehabilitation .
